intro: Hieracium buhsei, commonly known as Buhse's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe, particularly in the Alps. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
